creator: jdriller@orchid.org
text:
In order to install a fresh version of Apache I need to uninstall the old one. 
http://nagoya.apache.org/mirror/httpd/binaries/win32/#msi lists a 'here' link 
to old binaries (http://nagoya.apache.org/mirror/httpd/binaries/win32/.old/) 
but it does not work. All users who installed the older versions can't 
upgrade.... 

I see no webmaster link to notify anyone about this...

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Because you passed through the redirector, and the mirror wasn't mirroring
  the .old/ contents.  As much as it pains me, we have no big releases at
  the moment that i've seen notice of, and it is a weekend.

  So I've renamed .old to old so that mirrors pick it up.  That will eat a
  chunky bit of bandwidth but is necessary since nobody is 'forced' to carry
  hidden directories, such as .old, and we aren't providing the option of
  grabbing the file directly.

Ouch.  Two things:

1. Isn't there any way of not requiring the installer to do the uninstall. 
(Forgive me, I know nothing of msi.)

2. The whole "old" directory concept is death to mirrors.  Shouldn't we
be using symlinks like suggested here:
http://www.apache.org/dev/mirrors.html
creator: slive@apache.org
